channel.title: So I Want to Host a Server
channel.description:
But I can't pay for a dedi or VPS. The type of server I'm developing would surely be fairly popular, and Rarity is good enough to be hosted on a poor computer and still handle a good amount of players, but my internet isn't reliable enough and I don't have a spare monitor/mouse/keyboard. I have a bank account, but PayPal isn't an option due to various reasons. I'm not exactly looking to make money with the server, just a way to pay for hosting. What are some things you guys do/have done that haven't crapped out on you in a month because the company you were with decided to fuck you over?
Thanks,
~Lin

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“PvPXile, post:13, topic:477639”]Just becuase that guy is a staffhunting mong, you can use my other PC set up with remote access. Again it has a static IP, open dns router and PC sided and it’s served the customer well for 9 years.

Over 75K bootups, HD is in perfect condition and the 1GB ram it has, DDR, is still in good nick.

If you want it, it’s yours.[/quote]
I’m a staffhunting “mong” really?
It’s a form of payment, in which Lin has every right to revoke if I were to go ‘mad with power’ or not meet up to the standards.
Silly Goose.

Read full topic
item.source: So I Want to Host a Server

Just becuase that guy is a staffhunting mong, you can use my other PC set up with remote access. Again it has a static IP, open dns router and PC sided and it’s served the customer well for 9 years.

Over 75K bootups, HD is in perfect condition and the 1GB ram it has, DDR, is still in good nick.

If you want it, it’s yours.

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Here’s the specs of the computer I’d be letting you use, Lin:
Windows 7 Home premium.
6Gigs of RAM.
Intel Core 2 CPU (Dual core?) clocked at 1.86GHZ.
64bit OS.
I was planing on upgrading the computer, but I haven’t found a good source of funds.

Read full topic
item.source: So I Want to Host a Server

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:10, topic:477639”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=595836.msg4195592#msg4195592 date=1357445382]
What are the specs you will be looking for?
[/quote]Windows XP SP3 or above for the operating system (Windows Server 2003 should work if it can run the .NET Framework 4.0), single core processor clocked at about 1GHz+ and 512MB+ RAM. Rarity has no problems at all handling hundreds of players and NPCs in the same region on my computer running Windows 7 with 2GB RAM and an AMD Athlon 64 x2 @ 2.00GHz with tons of other stuff being ran in the background.[/quote]

Really the best you can do right now is computer host it if someone is nice enough to give you access to their computer.

You may also find someone with a vps their not using and give you access for a certain fee, but once you’re able to get a little money for the server it should be a bit easier since you could set up an ad scene.

Read full topic
item.source: So I Want to Host a Server

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:9, topic:477639”]What are the specs you will be looking for?[/quote]Windows XP SP3 or above for the operating system (Windows Server 2003 should work if it can run the .NET Framework 4.0), single core processor clocked at about 1GHz+ and 512MB+ RAM. Rarity has no problems at all handling hundreds of players and NPCs in the same region on my computer running Windows 7 with 2GB RAM and an AMD Athlon 64 x2 @ 2.00GHz with tons of other stuff being ran in the background.

Read full topic

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:7, topic:477639”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=595836.msg4195514#msg4195514 date=1357438656]
Borrow money from a family member then pay them back with irl money. Get the server a little bit known about and people usually offer payment/a donation in advance. Since your good at programming you could programme for irl gps on R-S though… You can get 1 month VPSs from $5+ that are able to host RSPSs until you can get enough money for a better one. I’m assuming you want a VPS for it as your going to have people playing on it while you improve it?
[/quote]Well the problem with donations is payment services don’t like the word “donation” if you offer anything in return. I guess the advice I’m looking for is how to accept payments and what payment service I can use.[/quote]
You could do a paypal bridge (what I call it). Make a dummy e-mail and a paypal with it. Have all payments go to that, and send money from that one to your real one.
That’s the best method I can think of, and it’s never failed me.

Read full topic
item.source: So I Want to Host a Server

Since your good at programming you could programme for irl gps on R-S though… You can get 1 month VPSs from $5+ that are able to host RSPSs until you can get enough money for a better one. I’m assuming you want a VPS for it as your going to have people playing on it while you improve it?[/quote]Well the problem with donations is payment services don’t like the word “donation” if you offer anything in return. I guess the advice I’m looking for is how to accept payments and what payment service I can use.

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:5, topic:477639”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=595836.msg4195507#msg4195507 date=1357438270]
I’ve got a spare computer not doing anything right now. It’s got 6GBS RAM, and hasn’t been shut off since I booted it up… If you’d like to use it; I just require Admin+ on the server
[/quote]
You shouldn’t ask for something in return for something like this. I’m sure Lin would/would’ve given you something nice in return sometime like most people but it just makes you sound like a twelve year old begging for a staff spot lol.

@OP
Rs related =
Borrow money from a family member then pay them back with irl money. Get the server a little bit known about and people usually offer payment/a donation in advance. Since your good at programming you could programme for irl gps on R-S though… You can get 1 month VPSs from $5+ that are able to host RSPSs until you can get enough money for a better one. I’m assuming you want a VPS for it as your going to have people playing on it while you improve it?[/quote]
It’s an offer. I can set up the computer for a person and take the monitor off, and throw it in my closet so I won’t be tempted to use.
Plus, it’s better than charging X amount of dollars for it. I’ve already port forwarded it and it’s got a static IP. My internet never goes offline. But hey, it’s his pick.

Read full topic
item.source: So I Want to Host a Server

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:477639”][quote author=Lin link=topic=595836.msg4195351#msg4195351 date=1357423840]
But I can’t pay for a dedi or VPS. The type of server I’m developing would surely be fairly popular, and Rarity is good enough to be hosted on a poor computer and still handle a good amount of players, but my internet isn’t reliable enough and I don’t have a spare monitor/mouse/keyboard. I have a bank account, but PayPal isn’t an option due to various reasons. I’m not exactly looking to make money with the server, just a way to pay for hosting. What are some things you guys do/have done that haven’t crapped out on you in a month because the company you were with decided to love you over?

Thanks,

~Lin
[/quote]
I’ve got a spare computer not doing anything right now. It’s got 6GBS RAM, and hasn’t been shut off since I booted it up… If you’d like to use it; I just require Admin+ on the server :)[/quote]
You shouldn’t ask for something in return for something like this. I’m sure Lin would/would’ve given you something nice in return sometime like most people but it just makes you sound like a twelve year old begging for a staff spot lol.

@OP

Borrow money from a family member then pay them back with irl money. Get the server a little bit known about and people usually offer payment/a donation in advance. Since your good at programming you could programme for irl gps on R-S though… You can get 1 month VPSs from $5+ that are able to host RSPSs until you can get enough money for a better one. I’m assuming you want a VPS for it as your going to have people playing on it while you improve it?

Read full topic

item.title: So I Want to Host a Server
item.dc:creator: @PvPXile PvPXile
item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:477639”][quote author=Lin link=topic=595836.msg4195351#msg4195351 date=1357423840]
But I can’t pay for a dedi or VPS. The type of server I’m developing would surely be fairly popular, and Rarity is good enough to be hosted on a poor computer and still handle a good amount of players, but my internet isn’t reliable enough and I don’t have a spare monitor/mouse/keyboard. I have a bank account, but PayPal isn’t an option due to various reasons. I’m not exactly looking to make money with the server, just a way to pay for hosting. What are some things you guys do/have done that haven’t crapped out on you in a month because the company you were with decided to love you over?

Thanks,

~Lin
[/quote]
I’ve got a spare computer not doing anything right now. It’s got 6GBS RAM, and hasn’t been shut off since I booted it up… If you’d like to use it; I just require Admin+ on the server :)[/quote]

^ ^

I work part time as a technician and any supposedly “bust” computers customers no longer want, need or can’t fund for repairs are in my loft.

Every time I need to host I hook it up to my smallscreen monitor under my desk and host 24/7 on one of them.

Read full topic
